alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 12:42AM CST until February 14 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of west central Minnesota and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM CST early this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility in open country. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
